page.title: 14MARYKIRK HALL
page.content: The hall is situated at the north end of the village. It is 64 years old and is run by a hall committee of village people. The caretaker, who is paid, looks after the hall, cleans it and opens it for hall users. Organizations like the{youth club} ,indoor bowling club, Women's Rural Institute, badminton club and the hall committee use the hall for meetings and functions such as concerts, rainbow whists, coffee mornings, bingo, sales of work and dances. The youth club is for people of 11 years and over. There are adults in charge at the weekly Tuesday meetings. Snooker, table tennis, computer games, badminton, darts and swingball are available and there is a small tuck shop. Sometimes members go to Dundee Ice Skating Rink in the evening.
